element.name: DESCRIPTION
element.text:
This algorithm uses different predictive analysis methods to create suitability maps.
It takes as input a points layer with information about the presence of a certain phenomena and a set of raster layer with variables that influence the presence of that phenomena. Based on the values of those variables in the input points, it performs different analysis and estimates the probability of finding the phenomena in the remaining cells of the analysis area.

element.name: INPUT
element.text: One or several layers with variables that affect the presence of the studied phenomena

element.name: POINTS
element.text: Presence points. Only coordinates are used, so the attributes table can contain any number of fields and any kind of information.

element.name: METHOD
element.text: The following methods are available: * Distance to mean value * Distance of Mahalanobis * BIOCLIM

element.name: RESULT
element.text:
Values in this layer indicate the probability of finding the studied phenomena in each cell.
